channel.title: Chaos Altar
channel.description: All ancient curses are added, I have the chaos altar at home, but you can't click on it, anyone know how to add it? Thanks!

item.title: Chaos Altar
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

jamesiscool12345678910:

I figured this would be easier, apparently not.

Well we could give you the code and the location where it is supposed to be, if we had your files but if everyone would be like “I figured asking the code would be easier than finding it or learning how to code.” then there wouldn’t be much people that could help others out since everyone expects someone else to do it.

On another note, not all sources are the same therefor it’s hard for others to know the method name you seek without knowing what source you’re using or without seeing your files. I told you the location where it is supposed to go. Now you need the method which you’ll have to place between the case 61: code Docent provided in an earlier reply.

Try giving a source name or providing your files related to magic. (Pastebin.com)

Read full topic

item.title: Chaos Altar
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

FirstClickObject.handleClick(c, objectType, obX, obY);

So you’d want to go to your FirstClickObject.java file and inside the handleClick methode you’d place it.

(Being here? game.net.packets.object.FirstClickObject;)

Read full topic

item.title: Chaos Altar
item.dc:creator: @jamesiscool123456789 jamesiscool12345678910
item.description:
@jamesiscool123456789 wrote:

Where should I add it?,there is no case’s in my ActionHandler.

package game.player;

import game.net.packets.npc.FirstClickNpc;
import game.net.packets.npc.SecondClickNpc;
import game.net.packets.npc.ThirdClickNpc;
import game.net.packets.object.FirstClickObject;
import game.net.packets.object.SecondClickObject;
import game.net.packets.object.ThirdClickObject;

public class ActionHandler {

private final Player c;

public ActionHandler(final Player Client) {
	c = Client;
}

public void firstClickNpc(final int i) {
	FirstClickNpc.handleClick(c, i);
}

public void firstClickObject(final int objectType, final int obX,
		final int obY) {
	FirstClickObject.handleClick(c, objectType, obX, obY);
}

public void secondClickNpc(final int npcId) {
	SecondClickNpc.handleClick(c, npcId);
}

public void secondClickObject(final int objectType, final int obX,
		final int obY) {
	SecondClickObject.handleClick(c, objectType, obX, obY);
}

public void thirdClickNpc(final int npcId) {
	ThirdClickNpc.handleClick(c, npcId);
}

public void thirdClickObject(final int objectType, final int obX,
		final int obY) {
	ThirdClickObject.handleClick(c, objectType, obX, obY);
}

}

Read full topic

item.title: Chaos Altar
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Look for like ActionHandler or WalktoActionHandler.java and within the switch statement that is in there (read the method because there are multiple ones) add a case and the case number is the ID of the object. Ex.

case 61:
player.switchPrayerBooks(2);
break;

Now dont use this exactly because I don’t know your methods but this is basically what it should be.

Read full topic
